sanskrit_verse:
नवेनानर्चिता ह्यस्य पशुहव्येन चाग्नयः ।
प्राणानेवात्तुमिच्छन्ति नवान्नामिषगर्धिनः ॥ ४.२८॥
transliteration: navenānarcitā hyasya paśuhavyena cāgnayaḥ | prāṇānevāttumicchanti navānnāmiṣagar dhinaḥ || 4.28||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those who perform no new offerings and disregard the sacred fires, desiring only flesh and material gain, seek to consume even life itself through their degraded conduct.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from alignment with Agni (Divine Will), not personal desire.
Causation originates in consciousness distortion toward materialism.
Capacity-based responsibility arises from voluntary disengagement with sacrificial order.
Restoration logic requires reconnection with Vedic fire ritual as consciousness purification.
Consciousness alignment necessitates abandonment of flesh-driven intent.
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual performs no new offerings AND neglects sacred fire rituals THEN capacity for societal integration is diminished UNTIL corrective ritual engagement occurs.
IF a person prioritizes flesh consumption over spiritual discipline THEN legal recognition of moral agency is suspended UNTIL purification protocols are completed.
IF community observes degradation in ritual observance THEN automatic invocation of restorative fire ceremonies shall occur at local temple levels.
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, failure to uphold Vedic sacrificial duties constitutes a forfeiture of full legal standing until rectified through prescribed ritual completion. Such individuals are deemed unready for judicial participation due to compromised consciousness integrity.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that misalignment with Agni leads to sequential degradation of life-force. Responsibility lies not in punishment but in compulsory restoration via yajña-based reintegration, aligning action with cosmic order without inflicting suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Mandatory attendance at Navahotra Yajña for 21 days under priestly supervision.
Daily recitation of Gayatri Mantra before sunrise until consciousness clarity is restored.
Community service within Agnihotra temples to rebuild connection with divine fire.
Temporary suspension of civic privileges until successful completion of purification rites.
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: Dharma prevails through conscious restoration, not punitive suffering; Agni judges all deeds, and only alignment with it restores rightful place in society. Reality remains ever non-punitive when guided by Sanatana Dharma.
